member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Scu.Common.AfterNActionEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the AfterNAction event.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Dicom.Scu.Common.AfterNActionEventArgs.#ctor(Leadtools.Dicom.Scu.Common.DicomScp,System.Byte,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,Leadtools.Dicom.DicomCommandStatusType,System.Int32,Leadtools.Dicom.DicomDataSet)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AfterNActionEventArgs class.
member.param: The peer connection that was sent the N-ACTION-REQ.
The Presentation Context ID. The ID provides information about both the class type of the data and the Transfer Syntax to use when transferring the data.

The Message ID. Each message sent by a member of a connection should have a unique ID. Since a member of a connection may send several messages, this ID allows that member to identify when a specific request has been completed.
The class affected by the request. This will be a SOP Class or a Meta SOP Class.
The instance of the class. A server may, for example, have three instances of the Nuclear Medicine Class. This value identifies the data with a specific instance.
The status of the original request.
An application-specific action that was performed on the specified Data Set.
A DicomDataSet object that contains the Data Set resulting from the specified.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BeforeNActionEventArgs class.

The Presentation Context ID. The ID provides information about both the class type of the data and the Transfer Syntax to use when transferring the data.

The Message ID. Each message sent by a member of a connection should have a unique ID. Since a member of a connection may send several messages, this ID allows that member to identify when a specific request has been completed.
The class affected by the request. This will be a SOP Class or a Meta SOP Class.

An application-specific action to be performed on the specified Data Set.
A DicomDataSet object that contains the Data Set on which the specified action is to be performed.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Dicom.Scu.Common.InstanceAvailability
member.summary: The availability of the referenced Instance

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Scu.Common.InstanceAvailability.NotProvided
member.summary: Value not provided.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Scu.Common.InstanceAvailability.Online
member.summary: Instances are immediately available from the Retrieve AE Title (0008,0054), and if a C-MOVE were to be requested, it would succeed in a reasonably short time.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Scu.Common.InstanceAvailability.Nearline
member.summary: Instances need to be retrieved from relatively slow media such as optical disk or tape. If a C-MOVE were to be requested from the Retrieve AE Title (0008,0054), it would succeed, but may take a considerable time'

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Scu.Common.InstanceAvailability.Offline
member.summary: A manual intervention is needed before the instances may be retrieved. If a C-MOVE were to be requested from the Retrieve AE Title (0008,0054), it would fail (e.g., by timeout) without such manual intervention.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Dicom.Scu.Common.InstanceAvailability.Unavailable
member.summary: Instances cannot be retrieved from the Retrieve AE Title (0008,0054). If a C-MOVE were to be requested, it would fail. Note that SOP Instances that are unavailable from this AE may be available from other AEs, or may have an alternate representation that is available from this AE.

The Message ID. Each message sent by a member of a connection should have a unique ID. Since a member of a connection may send several messages, this ID allows that member to identify when a specific request has been completed.

The status of the original reques.
An application-specific action.
A DicomDataSet object that contains the Data Set resulting from the specified action.

The Message ID. Each message sent by a member of a connection should have a unique ID. Since a member of a connection may send several messages, this ID allows that member to identify when a specific request has been completed.

The status of the original request.
